alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 7:13PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain during the past few hours. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen to the north and west of Caribou. - Additional rainfall amounts up to one half of an inch is expected over the area this evening. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Washburn, Woodland, New Sweden, Connor, Perham, Caswell, Wade, Hamlin, Westmanland and Cyr Plantation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
